meanings.definition: (紋章学)盾の両脇に弧状に張り出した部分
meanings.english_definition: (heraldry) One of the ordinaries formed by an arched line drawn from the upper corner of the shield to the base point of the same side. Always borne in pairs.

examples.sentence: The shield was decorated with a flanch on either side.
examples.translation: 盾は両側にフランシュで装飾されていた。

etymology.value: From Old French flanche, from flanc (“side”).
